Vocabularies.Definition: 利用一切机会
死于
n.      spending of money; cost 花费；代价
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   It's too much of an expense to own a car.

Vocabularies.Definition: （对…）有控制力或支配权
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The Australians are in control of the island.

Vocabularies.Definition: regard as the aim of one's life 将…作为自己的生活目标
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He lived for his work.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.   attend or hold social parties 参加（或举办）社交聚会
(pleaded or pled) v.  give (sth.) as an excuse or explanation, esp. for doing sth. wrong; make repeated urgent requests (for sth.)   提出…作为借口（或理由）；恳求
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Alice pleaded illness as her reason for being absent.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.      more than enough 大量的，许多的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Fish are plentiful in the lake.

Vocabularies.Definition: (quit or quitted) v.  stop; give up (one's job); leave 停止；辞去（工作）；离开
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He quit because the salary was too low.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.       反应
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He suffered an allergic reaction to penicillin.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.    start (sth.) again; give new energy to 重新开始；使恢复
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   We renewed our discussion after a ten minute break.

Vocabularies.Definition: try to find or obtain  寻找；设法得到
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Young graduates are seeking after success in life.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.     一学期；半学年
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She took five courses during the fall semester.

Vocabularies.Definition: begin (a job, task, etc.) with a particular aim 着手做（某事）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   They succeeded in what they set out to do.

Vocabularies.Definition: take in, absorb 吸收，吸取
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The paper towel will soak up the spilt coffee.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.    搅动，搅和； 激起
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She stirred the sugar into the mixture.

Vocabularies.Definition: 收回；取回
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I take back what I said.

Vocabularies.Definition: get honor, praise or approval （因…）获得荣誉（赞誉或认可）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I can't take all the credit; the others did all the work.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  lasting for a short time 暂时的，临时的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The temporary worker was soon replaced by a permanent employee.

Vocabularies.Definition: make unhappy and worried, etc. 使忧心忡忡
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The bank is being weighed down by a $1.3 billion book of bad debts.
